image.altText: The torso of a person in a paramedic uniform from the side.

props.synopsis: Almost 90 per cent of NT paramedics have no confidence in the private ambulance service's executive leadership and almost all have concerns about patient safety, a union survey has found.

title.children: 'Overwhelming' vote of no confidence in NT ambulance service executive

image.altText: An outback station as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A cattle company owned by the Holmes à Court family has just paid $12.8 million for a property near Katherine.

title.children: One of NT's smallest cattle stations sells for $12.8m

image.altText: a rocket launches in the outback

props.synopsis: The Arnhem Space Centre will cease operations effective immediately, the company behind it says, while unveiling plans to move the facility to Cape York in Queensland.

title.children: NT space base that launched NASA rockets to cease operations

image.altText: A rainbow in a full arch reaches over the red soil horizon line. Huge storm clouds are in the background. It's wet.

props.synopsis: Swimmers are splashing in the Todd River and a resident has been flooded in as the southern NT welcomes a wet start to summer.

title.children: Outback rivers flowing as 'beautiful' rain 'hammers down' on Red Centre

image.altText: A boy holds a sign reading stop the bashing swearing and killing

props.synopsis: Aboriginal men have led a march through Alice Springs calling for an end to domestic violence, following a landmark inquest examining the issue.

title.children: 'Not a women's issue': Alice Springs Aboriginal men lead anti-DV march

image.altText: A drone photo of a coastline with blue ocean, yellow sand and lush green.

props.synopsis: A multi-agency border operation has been launched in the Northern Territory to target a rise in illegal fishing and people smuggling through Arnhem Land waters.

title.children: Border Force to target foreign boat arrivals in northern Australia

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman looking serious.

props.synopsis: The family of an Indigenous woman killed in a hit-and-run in Darwin have spoken out after the man who struck her and tried to cover it up, leaving her disembodied leg on the highway, was released from prison on appeal.

title.children: Hit-run victim's family 'disgusted' after killer released from prison

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket and sunglasses

props.synopsis: The chief executive of the Northern Territory's biggest legal aid provider has rejected a $1.5 million offer from the agency to settle a long-running Federal Court case.

title.children: NAAJA CEO seeking upward of $1.5m in damages after unlawful sacking

image.altText: A young First Nations woman in a radio studio with an ABC mic in front of her and headset on. White shirt smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Thirty-eight young people have been named 2025 ABC Heywire winners for their resilience, courage and desire to create change. Here's where you can find their stories.

title.children: Heywire winners reveal 'brave and authentic' stories of regional Australia

image.altText: A boy goes to give an excited Albanese a high five in a classroom

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has made an election pitch for a $1 billion fund to construct more childcare centres, including some co-located inside schools, and the end to the "activity test" that restricts child care subsidies.

title.children: PM pitches $1bn childcare building fund, more days of subsidised care

image.altText: An elderly lady with a baton

props.synopsis: Olympian Dawn Fraser's daughter says her mother is doing "so much better" after the swimming legend had an emergency hip replacement earlier this week.

title.children: Olympian Dawn Fraser's family thought they would 'lose her' after fall

image.altText: Supporters of Hezbollah gather waving yellow flags and the flag of Lebanon in Beirut

props.synopsis: The fall of Syrian president Bashar Al-assad has dealt another major blow to Iran's so-called "Axis of Resistance", coming as Hamas and Hezbollah were already weakened. Now the future of the alliance is being questioned.

title.children: Fall of Assad 'another nail in the coffin' for Iran's Axis of Resistance

image.altText: bald man with tinted glasses and short beard

props.synopsis: Queensland doctor Csaba Varga had contacted a friend late on Saturday to say he was lost at Wollumbin/Mt Warning. Today he found his way to a road and flagged down a car.

title.children: Missing doctor walks out of dense NSW bushland after being lost for days

image.altText: man with curly blonde hair in a suit walks out of court as cameras flash in his face

props.synopsis: A jury acquits Daniel Penny of killing Jordan Neely by putting him in a chokehold on a subway train, an incident that quickly went viral.

title.children: Ex-marine acquitted of murdering a street performer on a subway train

image.altText: India bowler Arundhati Reddy appeals for an Australian wicket during an ODI cricket match.

props.synopsis: The series may not be on the line, but Australian and Indian players will want to produce their best with the 50-over World Cup approaching in September. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie top order wilts in searing heat against India at WACA

image.altText: A man vaping tilts his head upwards as a plume of smoke rises from his mouth and nose.

props.synopsis: Pharmacy chain Chemist Warehouse and big tobacco have become unlikely rivals, in a battle to gain market share among Australia's nicotine-addicted smokers and vapers.

title.children: 'It's a con': Prescribed vapes set to cost taxpayers millions

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market ended lower on Wednesday after the RBA left interest rates on hold again, while Chemist Warehouse announced plans to make its ASX debut next February.

title.children: Chemist Warehouse could hit ASX by February, local shares end lower — as it happened

image.altText: A Rex plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator ASIC is suing Rex Airlines, alleging the company and four of its directors engaged in "deceptive and misleading conduct" over its profitability.

title.children: ASIC sues Rex, alleging airline misled market on profitability

image.altText: A barista performs coffee art while pouring milk from a jug into a cup of coffee.

props.synopsis: Global coffee bean prices have soared to their highest level in nearly half a century due to bad weather in major coffee growing regions.

title.children: Coffee drinkers to feel the pinch as prices hit record high

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: Emil Petrov wears a black waterproof jacket over a cream coloured shirt and has brown rimmed glasses resting on his forehead.

props.synopsis: A jury finds Emil "Bill" Petrov guilty of the violent murder of Cindy Crossthwaite in her Melton South home in Melbourne's north-west in 2007.

title.children: Family remember 'beautiful girl' as husband found guilty of murder

image.altText: Water bottles in vending machine

props.synopsis: Tests conducted by NSW Health found forever chemicals at levels that exceed Australian drinking water guidelines in a bore water supply at Warialda, about 200 kilometres north of Tamworth.

title.children: Free bottled water for residents of NSW town after PFAS discovery

image.altText: In this nature preserve in Italy it appears this red squirrel is stuck in a tree trunk.

props.synopsis: The competition, which has been going since 2015, offers a place for nature photographers to show off the amusing snapshots they've captured while documenting the natural world.

title.children: 'Stuck squirrel' chosen as the year's best wildlife comedy photo

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock speaks to reporters at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank board teases borrowers by extending hopes of a February rate cut, but will it arrive?

title.children: The RBA should remain 'alert' to a 'sudden unravelling' of jobs market

image.altText: A Tasmanian aboriginal elder wearing  a yellow t-shirt with the aboriginal flag on it.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Aboriginal elder Jim Everett again refused attendance at a court hearing where he was convicted on multiple charges. He agreed to pay fines relating to 'social laws' but continues protesting the court's jurisdiction over him.

title.children: Aboriginal elder agrees to pay fine but snubs 'colonial court' fee

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Hiker spotted 16 helicopters landing on pristine beach, then a row started

image.altText: plane sunset generic thumbnail

props.synopsis: As Australians gear up for the holiday season, new research reveals the growing environmental cost of global tourism.

title.children: Desire for travel driving a surge in emissions, researchers say

props.synopsis: With sweeping legislation banning children from social media, these massive multiplayer communities have taken another path to provide a wholesome online space.

title.children: These online communities show you can keep people safe without bans

image.altText: A collection of scrolled parchments.

props.synopsis: As counter-terrorism police investigate the torching of a Melbourne synagogue on Friday, its community is fighting to save priceless Torah scrolls damaged in the arson attack.

title.children: Each scroll damaged in Melbourne's synagogue blaze 'has its own story'

image.altText: A hand holds the Essure contraceptive device

props.synopsis: Despite a Victorian judge rejecting claims that a female contraceptive device caused them major health problems, women engaged in a class action have vowed to keep fighting.

title.children: Women 'collectively crushed' as court rejects Essure class action claim

image.altText: Police cars and officers on a suburban street. Police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: NSW Police say a man in custody is expected to be charged with murder later this afternoon, following the discovery of a woman's body in a unit in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Murder charge expected after woman's body found in Sydney home

image.altText: Two men and a woman wearing surgical scrubs look at the camera. The younger man is holding a newborn baby.

props.synopsis: British nurse and embryologist Jean Purdy was instrumental in the development of IVF in the 1960s, but wasn't officially acknowledged until nearly 40 years after her death. New film Joy tells her story.

title.children: Film tells story of nurses who defied controversy to help develop IVF

image.altText: Aerial photograph of a rose garden planted in the shape of an Arabian horse.

props.synopsis: When a Facebook group of nearly 2 million Google Earth enthusiasts homed in on a satellite image of an odd garden in northern Tasmania, its creator responded.

title.children: 'Thanks for noticing': Secret garden spotted on Google Earth 25 years after being built

image.altText: A police car on the street outside a home.

props.synopsis: Queensland police allege a woman was killed five days before her body was found in a Townsville unit.

title.children: Man charged with murder in third Townsville DV death in three months

image.altText: A police officer carrying a woman from a building following an airstrike.

props.synopsis: The comments come after Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy told incoming US President Donald Trump he would be open to talks, but was sceptical Vladimir Putin would want peace.

title.children: Ukraine hit by strikes as ally hints peace talks possible within months
